p: A case of chronic meningococcemia diagnosed in a vertically infected adolescent with human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection will be described, providing a review of the literature on the topic. Its importance lies in the description of a rare disease with atypical manifestation, which is difficult to suspect, and which may be life-threatening if not diagnosed and treated promptly and adequately. This case report was approved by local ethics committee; the patient signed the consent form, with permission to disclose images.
